case_vignette:
A 8-year-old male with no significant past medical history presents to the emergency room with fever, headache, malaise and rhinorrhea ongoing for past two days with recent known tick exposure. Parents deny any recent medication exposures. He is admitted to the hospital and over the next few days, he develops a rash beginning on the ankles and wrists that progressively spread onto the trunk. Physical examination reveals blanching erythematous macules on ankles, wrists, and trunk with few scattered petechiae and purpura on the bilateral ankles. He is mildly febrile and labs do not demonstrate any leukocytosis. The patient is diagnosed with Rocky Mountain spotted fever (RMSF) and is started on doxycycline. The patient is closely monitored for signs of complications and is eventually discharged home after 5 days of treatment.

The patient is mildly febrile and labs do not demonstrate any leukocytosis. The patient is diagnosed with Rocky Mountain spotted fever (RMSF) and is started on doxycycline. The patient is closely monitored for signs of complications and is eventually discharged home after 5 days of treatment.

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a fever, headache, general discomfort, and a runny nose.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I've been experiencing these symptoms for the past two days.
Have you noticed any rash on your skin? If so, can you describe it?
Yes, I have a rash that started on my ankles and wrists and spread to my trunk. It consists of red spots, some of which are just red and others that are tiny red or purple bruises.
Do you have any history of similar symptoms in the past or any chronic illnesses?
No, I have no significant past medical history.
Have you taken any new medications or been exposed to any new substances or environments recently?
No, there have been no recent medication exposures, but I was exposed to a tick recently.
Did the tick bite you, and if so, where on your body?
Yes, I was known to have been exposed to a tick recently.
Final Diagnosis: Rocky Mountain spotted fever.
